Key Match Events: The Mets committed four errors in three NLCS games.
Francisco Alvarez's throw to second base allowed Max Muncy to reach safely.
Luis Severino bobbled a potential double-play ball and deflected a comebacker, allowing a run to score.
Tyrone Taylor made a sliding catch in the right-center-field gap, preventing a two-run extra-base hit.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of limiting mistakes to win ballgames.
Francisco Lindor reflected on the tough inning and the need to be better in future games.
Luis Severino acknowledged his mistakes in the second inning but felt he pitched well otherwise.
Tyrone Taylor expressed his commitment to making crucial defensive plays and helping the team.
